supercontext.mission: Capture the latest metadata fixes and model-catalog planning work in release notes, then stage a version bump before shipping the implementation orders.

goal: Document recent changes (OSS metadata anomalies, new orders), bump the project version appropriately, and prepare tagging instructions.
execution_instructions: Read CLAUDE.md and AGENTS.md for release workflow guardrails.
Do not implement features or refactors here—focus on documentation and versioning metadata.
If the working tree is dirty, resolve or document before proceeding.

steps: Run `git status` to ensure only intended files are touched.
Review existing release notes/CHANGELOG to determine the last published entry.

Create or update `docs/reports/release-notes/<next-version>.md` (or `CHANGELOG.md`) with sections for "Fixes" (metadata model/timing gaps), "Planning" (model catalog v2 architecture), and "Upcoming" (implementation order).
Call out known limitations (e.g., Qwen still speculative until registry work lands).
Mention any new orders that stakeholders should execute next.
Determine whether the changes warrant a patch or minor bump (likely patch unless catalog refactor is imminent).
Update `pyproject.toml` (and other references) to the new version.
Note the rationale for the bump in the release notes.
Verify the working tree is clean aside from release note/version files.
Document tagging instructions (e.g., `git tag -a vX.Y.Z -m "Release notes"`).
List follow-on tasks (run metadata fix order, execute catalog implementation).

acceptance_criteria: Release notes reflect the metadata issues, architecture planning, and next steps.
Version in `pyproject.toml` is bumped with a documented rationale.
Tagging instructions are recorded and the working tree is clean.
Known limitations and upcoming work are clearly communicated.

what_not_to_do: Do not modify code apart from version strings.
Do not push tags/commits—provide instructions only.
Avoid editing unrelated documentation or configs unless required for the release entry.
constraints.escalation_guidance: If conflicting version numbers exist, document the discrepancy and pause the order for clarification.

required_commands: uv run python -m unittest discover -s tests -p "test_classification_prompt.py"
testing.notes: The goal is to confirm the repo is healthy before the release; no new tests are introduced here.
